org.jamesframework.ext.permutation.neigh.moves

Class ReverseSubsequenceMove

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.ext.permutation.neigh.moves.ReverseSubsequenceMove
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.jamesframework.core.search.neigh.Move<PermutationSolution>

    public class ReverseSubsequenceMove
extends Object
implements org.jamesframework.core.search.neigh.Move<PermutationSolution>
    A move that reverses a subsequence of a permutation.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ReverseSubsequenceMove(int from, int to)
      Create a move that will reverse the subsequence from one up to another position in the permutation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void apply(PermutationSolution solution)
      Reverse the subsequence by performing a series of swaps in the given permutation solution.
      boolean equals(Object obj)
      Two moves of this type are considered equals if they reverse the same subsequence.
      int getFrom()
      Get the first position in the reversed subsequence.
      int getTo()
      Get the last position in the reversed subsequence.

      Hash code computation corresponding to implementation of equals(Object).

      Get string indicating move type and bounds of reversed subsequence.
      void undo(PermutationSolution solution)
      Undo move by reverting the order of the reversed subsequence.

        clone, finalize, getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReverseSubsequenceMove

        public ReverseSubsequenceMove(int from,
                              int to)
        Create a move that will reverse the subsequence from one up to another position in the permutation. It is allowed that from is larger than to as the first item is cyclically defined as the successor of the last item. Yet, both positions should be different.
        Parameters:
        from - first position of reversed subsequence
        to - last position of reversed subsequence
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if from and to are equal

    • Method Detail

      • getFrom

        public int getFrom()
        Get the first position in the reversed subsequence.
        Returns:
        initial position in the reversed subsequence

      • getTo

        public int getTo()
        Get the last position in the reversed subsequence.
        Returns:
        final position in the reversed subsequence

      • apply

        public void apply(PermutationSolution solution)
        Reverse the subsequence by performing a series of swaps in the given permutation solution.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface org.jamesframework.core.search.neigh.Move<PermutationSolution>
        Parameters:
        solution - permutation solution to which the move is to be applied

      • undo

        public void undo(PermutationSolution solution)
        Undo move by reverting the order of the reversed subsequence.
        Specified by:
        undo in interface org.jamesframework.core.search.neigh.Move<PermutationSolution>
        Parameters:
        solution - permutation solution to which the move had been applied

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Two moves of this type are considered equals if they reverse the same subsequence.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - object to compare for equality
        Returns:
        true if the other object is a move of the same type that reverses the same subsequence
